snippet: The postmaster general asked Congress to let the Postal Service run its own health plan, modify a mandate on a benefit fund and end Saturday mail delivery.
abstract: Postmaster General Patrick R Donahoe asks Congress to allow the Postal Service to change its business model to keep itself solvent, saying that its debt could reach $45 billion by 2017 if action is not taken; Donahoe is seeking permission for the department to run its own health plan, modify a mandate on a benefit fund and end Saturday mail delivery.
lead_paragraph: The postmaster general asked Congress to let the Postal Service run its own health plan, modify a mandate on a benefit fund and end Saturday mail delivery.

headline.seo: Postal Service Asks to Alter Business Model
headline.main: Debt Mounting, Postal Service Asks to Alter Business Model
headline.print_headline: Debt Mounting, Postal Service Asks to Alter Business Model
